item.title: 埃隆·马斯克对人工智能的执着追求，使他不断寻求资金支持
item.description:
不断攀升的成本引发了特斯拉与SpaceX合并的讨论，这位亿万富翁正试图利用其商业帝国为个人雄心壮志提供资金支持。【原文：

Spiraling costs have prompted talk of a Tesla and SpaceX merger as the billionaire looks to use his empire to fund his ambitions.

】

item.title: 印度股市从历史低点强劲反弹，因预算案临近
item.description: 印度股市在被誉为全球最平静股市仅数周后，波动性再度抬头。随着质疑声浪高涨，海外投资者正纷纷撤离。【原文：Indian stocks are seeing a resurgence of volatility just weeks after being dubbed the world’s calmest equity market, with growing skepticism sparking an exodus of overseas investors.】

item.title: 对人工智能的担忧阻碍德意志银行为康加公司提供12亿美元贷款协议
item.description: 由德意志银行牵头的贷款方集团面临风险，可能被迫承担约12亿美元贷款，这些贷款与收购一家人工智能驱动的软件供应商有关。由于投资者回避那些被认为容易受到免费人工智能工具竞争影响的企业，导致该集团陷入困境。【原文：A group of lenders led by Deutsche Bank AG is at risk of getting stuck with about $1.2 billion of loans linked to the acquisition of an artificial intelligence-driven software provider, as investors shy away from businesses perceived as vulnerable to competition from free AI tools.】

item.title: 巴西哈达德提名内阁盟友角逐央行空缺职位
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，巴西财政部长费尔南多·哈达德已向总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦提议，任命其财政部内部的一名盟友填补央行董事会的一个空缺席位。【原文：Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad has pitched President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on naming an ally from inside his ministry to an open seat on the central bank board, according to two people with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 亚马逊申请联邦通信委员会延长卫星许可期限，因火箭短缺
item.description: 亚马逊公司向美国联邦通信委员会申请延期，以满足在2026年中期前将1600多颗互联网卫星送入轨道的监管期限。该公司表示，延期的原因是发射卫星的火箭数量不足。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. asked the Federal Communications Commission for more time to meet a regulatory deadline to have more than 1,600 internet satellites in orbit by mid-2026, citing a shortage of rockets to launch them.】

item.title: Tether年度利润在融资过程中下降23%
item.description: 2025年，全球最大稳定币发行方Tether公布利润为100亿美元，较上年下降23%。该公司启动的融资进程将使其跻身估值最高的私营企业之列。【原文：Tether posted a $10 billion profit in 2025, down 23% from the previous year, as the world’s biggest stablecoin issuer launched a fundraising process that would make it one of the most highly valued private companies.】

item.title: 加拿大股市创关税风波以来最大跌幅 金属股暴跌
item.description: 加拿大股市遭遇四月关税公告引发市场动荡以来的最惨重跌幅，贵金属价格下跌拖累矿业股大幅下挫。【原文：Canadian stocks had their worst day since the market chaos in the wake of April’s tariff announcement, as a slide in precious metals sent mining stocks tumbling.】

item.title: 乐布布创客Pop Mart在伦敦设立欧洲业务中心
item.description: 波普艺术国际集团有限公司正在伦敦设立欧洲业务总部。这家中国拉布布收藏玩具制造商在美国取得突破性成功后，正寻求开拓新的增长市场。【原文：Pop Mart International Group Ltd. is setting up a London headquarters for its European operations as the Chinese maker of Labubu collectible toys seeks a new growth market after its breakout success in the US.】

item.title: 安德森·霍洛维茨助力人工智能行业中期融资5100万美元
item.description: 风险投资家马克·安德森和本·霍洛维茨是主要捐助者之一，他们为一个超级政治行动委员会筹集了5080万美元资金。该委员会计划在中期选举中投入巨资，以推动建立有利于人工智能发展的商业友好型监管环境。【原文：Venture capitalists Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz are among the major donors who fueled a $50.8 million haul for a super political action committee that plans to spend big in the midterm elections as it pursues a business-friendly regulatory environment for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 穆迪上调以色列信用展望，因冲突风险消退
item.description: 穆迪评级机构将以色列的信用展望从负面上调至稳定，理由是去年十月与哈马斯达成停火协议后地缘政治风险有所降低。【原文：Israel’s credit outlook was raised to stable from negative by Moody’s Ratings, which cited diminished geopolitical risks following the ceasefire with Hamas last October.】

item.title: 3D打印初创企业VulcanForms为美国制造业筹集2.2亿美元
item.description: 金属零件制造商VulcanForms公司已完成一轮融资，共筹集2.2亿美元资金，本轮融资由Eclipse和1789资本领投，后者是唐纳德·特朗普之子小唐纳德·特朗普担任合伙人的风险投资公司。【原文：Metal parts maker VulcanForms Inc. has raised $220 million in a funding round led by Eclipse and 1789 Capital, the VC firm where Donald Trump Jr. is a partner.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼称官员们在降息问题上"可以从容不迫"
item.description: 美联储负责监管事务的副主席米歇尔·鲍曼表示，鉴于通胀居高不下，且去年创纪录的政府停摆可能导致经济数据失真，存在诸多不确定性，她认为等待再降息具有合理性。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman said she saw merit in waiting to lower rates further given elevated inflation and uncertainty over potential distortions in economic data stemming from last year’s record-long government shutdown.】

item.title: 对冲基金趁伊朗风险与美国冻结令押注油价看涨
item.description: 对冲基金对布伦特原油的看涨情绪升至四月初以来最高水平，因特朗普总统宣称美国在伊朗周边加强军事部署，同时交易员密切关注一场大规模冬季风暴带来的影响。【原文：Hedge funds turned the most bullish on Brent oil since early April as President Donald Trump touted a growing US military presence near Iran and traders monitored the fallout from a sweeping winter storm.】

item.title: 安德森、Coinbase董事面临交易诉讼
item.description: 特拉华州一名法官裁定，尽管内部调查已认定被告无不当行为，但股东诉讼案仍可继续推进。该诉讼指控包括风险投资家马克·安德森在内的Coinbase Global Inc.数名董事涉嫌内幕交易。【原文：A Delaware judge ruled that a shareholder lawsuit alleging insider trading by several directors of Coinbase Global Inc., including venture capitalist Marc Andreessen, can proceed for now after an internal investigation cleared the defendants of wrongdoing.】

item.title: 2026年华尔街交易骤然崩盘 警示警钟齐鸣
item.description: 在华尔街这个以投资者拥挤和散户动能为特征的时代，本周展现了坚定信念如何迅速消散。【原文：In a Wall Street era marked by investor crowding and retail momentum, this week showed how quickly conviction can evaporate.】

item.title: 富达支持的广告技术平台Moloco据称正考虑上市
item.description: 知情人士透露，广告技术公司Moloco正考虑首次公开募股，这将为近期密集的潜在上市潮再添一员。【原文：Moloco, an advertising technology company, is considering an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter, adding to a flurry of potential listings.】

item.title: TLT交易员在特朗普提名沃什担任美联储主席前及时离场
item.description: 在特朗普任命沃什之前，ETF投资者早已开始抛售长期债券。【原文：ETF investors were offloading long-dated bonds well before Trump tapped Warsh.】

item.title: 对冲基金大幅削减白银看涨押注，降至23个月低点
item.description: 在白银价格遭遇数十年来最大跌幅之前，基金经理大幅削减了看涨白银的押注，其持仓量降至近两年最低水平。【原文：Money managers slashed their bullish silver wagers to the lowest in nearly two years in the run-up to the metal’s biggest plunge in decades.】

item.title: 富尔克姆称：沃什领导下的美联储消弭"卖美国"贸易风险
item.description: 富尔克姆资产管理公司表示，凯文·沃什被提名为下一任美联储主席，降低了美国资产遭遇全面抛售的风险，因市场预期他将致力于防范通胀。【原文：The nomination of Kevin Warsh as the next Federal Reserve chair diminishes the risk of a sweeping selloff in US assets as he is expected to guard against inflation, according to Fulcrum Asset Management.】

item.title: Peloton裁员11%，包括工程团队人员
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Peloton Interactive公司裁减了11%的员工，此次大规模裁员旨在削减成本。【原文：Peloton Interactive Inc. cut 11% of its employees, a giant cutback aimed at slashing costs, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 为何唱片公司依然重视iTunes
item.description: 超过80%的iTunes用户未订阅Apple Music，这代表着一个尚未开发的潜在市场。【原文：Over 80% of iTunes users are not subscribed to Apple Music, representing an untapped market】

item.title: 期权交易加剧黄金数十年最大跌幅
item.description: 黄金数十年来最大跌幅正因期权市场的交易而加剧。【原文：Gold’s biggest plunge in decades is being compounded by trading in the options market.】

item.title: 贝索斯旗下火箭公司蓝色起源将暂停太空旅游飞行
item.description: 杰夫·贝索斯旗下的蓝色起源公司宣布，将暂停太空旅游飞行“至少两年”，以便将资源转向加速月球着陆器及其他月球技术的研发。【原文：Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin will pause tourist flights to space for “no less than two years” in order to shift resources to accelerating the development of its moon lander and other lunar technologies, the company announced.】

item.title: Unity、电子游戏股价下跌，谷歌人工智能工具引发担忧
item.description: Unity软件公司及电子游戏类股周五暴跌，因谷歌启动"Project Genie"项目后，市场担忧人工智能可能引发行业颠覆。【原文：Unity Software Inc. and video game stocks plunge Friday on fears of possible artificial intelligence disruption after Google began to roll out Project Genie.】

item.title: 首批品牌商与债权人就债务归属问题启动调解
item.description: 第一品牌集团及其主要债权人将启动保密调解会议，试图解决一系列危及企业生存的纠纷。这些纠纷已使这家汽车零部件制造商濒临停产边缘，若停产将导致13,000名员工失业。【原文：First Brands Group and its main creditors will start confidential mediation sessions to potentially resolve a series of business-crippling disputes that have left the auto-parts maker weeks away from a shutdown that would throw 13,000 people out of work.】

item.title: 沃什即将面临现实考验，作为特朗普在美联储的代表
item.description: 凯文·沃什等待了近十年，终于获得唐纳德·特朗普总统提名担任美联储主席。而他上任后的首次重大考验，无需等待如此之久便会到来。【原文：Kevin Warsh waited almost a decade before finally clinching President Donald Trump’s nomination to be chair of the Federal Reserve. He won’t need to wait as long before his first big test in the job.】

item.description:

Understanding Trump's new Fed nominee.

item.title: 美元飙升，金属暴跌重创大宗商品货币
item.description: 美元汇率大幅攀升，创下自7月以来最大单日涨幅，因金银价格暴跌拖累了从澳大利亚到瑞典的各国货币。【原文：The dollar jumped, setting it up for its biggest one-day gain since July, as plunging gold and silver prices dragged down currencies from Australia to Sweden.】

item.title: 电力工程公司Solv寻求在美国IPO募资5.125亿美元
item.description: 索尔维能源公司计划通过首次公开募股筹集高达5.125亿美元资金，成为最新一批借数据中心日益增长的电力需求获利的企业之一。【原文：Solv Energy Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $512.5 million in an initial public offering, becoming one of the latest companies to capitalize on data centers’ increasing power needs.】

item.title: 欧瑞森的詹表示，"颠簸之路"是美元走弱的理想路径
item.description: 据欧瑞森SLJ资本的史蒂芬·詹分析，从美国官员的角度来看，美元走弱的理想路径可能并非平稳下滑，而是经历一系列波动的"颠簸之路"。【原文：The ideal path to a weaker dollar from the perspective of US officials may involve a “bumpy road” with a series of lurches, rather than a steady decline, according to Stephen Jen at Eurizon SLJ Capital.】
